5.text: The sons of Japheth; Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.

6.text: And the sons of Gomer; Ashchenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.

7.text: And the sons of Javan; Elisha, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

8.text: The sons of Ham; Cush, and Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

9.text: And the sons of Cush; Seba, and Havilah, and Sabta, and Raamah, and Sabtecha. And the sons of Raamah; Sheba, and Dedan.

10.text: And Cush begat Nimrod. He began to be mighty upon the earth.

11.text: And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,

12.text: And Pathrusim, and Casluhim, (of whom came the Philistines,) and Caphthorim.

13.text: And Canaan begat Zidon his first-born, and Heth,

14.text: The Jebusite also, and the Amorite, and the Girgashite,

15.text: And the Hivite, and the Archite, and the Sinite,

16.text: And the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.

17.text: The sons of Shem; Elam, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram, and Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Meshech.

18.text: And Arphaxad begat Shelah, and Shelah begat Eber.

19.text: And to Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg; because in his days the earth was divided: and his brother’s name was Joktan.

20.text: And Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,

21.text: Hadoram also, and Uzal, and Diklah,

22.text: And Ebal, and Abimael, and Sheba,

23.text: And Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

28.text: The sons of Abraham; Isaac, and Ishmael.

29.text: These are their generations. The first-born of Ishmael, Nebaioth; then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,

30.text: Mishma, and Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema,

31.text: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.

32.text: Now the sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: she bore Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan; Sheba, and Dedan.

33.text: And the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Henoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these are the sons of Keturah,

34.text: And Abraham begat Isaac. The sons of Isaac; Esau and Israel.

35.text: The sons of Esau; Eliphaz, Reuel, and Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.

36.text: The sons of Eliphaz; Teman, and Omar, Zephi, and Gatam, Kenaz, and Timna, and Amalek.

37.text: The sons of Reuel; Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.

38.text: And the sons of Seir; Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah, and Dishon, and Ezar, and Dishan.

39.text: And the sons of Lotan; Hori, and Homam: and Timna was Lotan’s sister.

40.text: The sons of Shobal; Alian, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. And the sons of Zibeon; Aiah, and Anah.

41.text: The sons of Anah; Dishon. And the sons of Dishon; Amram, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.

42.text: The sons of Ezer; Bilhan, and Zavan, and Jakan. The sons of Dishan; Uz, and Aran.

43.text: Now these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the children of Israel; Bela the son of Beor: and the name of his city was Dinhabah.

44.text: And when Bela was dead Jobab the son of Zera of Bozrah reigned in his stead.

45.text: And when Jobab was dead, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.

46.text: And when Husham was dead, Hadad the son of Bedad, who smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Avith.

47.text: And when Hadad was dead, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.

48.text: And when Samlah was dead, Shaul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.

49.text: And when Shaul was dead, Baal-hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.

50.text: And when Baal-hanan was dead, Hadad reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Pai; and his wife’s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.

51.text: Hadad died also. And the dukes of Edom were; duke Timna, duke Aliah, duke Jetheth,

52.text: Duke Aholibamah, duke Elah, duke Pinon,

53.text: Duke Kenaz, duke Teman, duke Mibzar,

54.text: Duke Magdiel, duke Iram. These are the dukes of Edom.
